Documentation: The load ID identifies the load, together with the consecutive number and the system partner, uniquely. The load ID is taken from the shipment frequency or the plan load (outbound delivery) depending on the ‘load creation kind’ of the outbound delivery type.
Unique identification of a system partner (see SystemPartner).
Identifies a consignment (together with the system partner) uniquely.
Unique identification of a system partner (see SystemPartner).
The loading sequence determines the order of consignments for loading
The unloading sequence defines the order of consignments for unloading.
The identification of the delivery category.
The date/time when all loading units of this delivery have to be in the staging area.
The date/time when all loading units of this delivery have to be loaded.
The time the delivery leaves the warehouse.
The time the delivery reaches the customer.
Date and time without seconds. See: DATETIME
Date and time without seconds. See: DATETIME
Number of whole LUs that are contained in the outbound delivery. Depending on the 'planning stage' the information isn't available at any time.
Number of picking LUs that are contained in the outbound delivery. Depending on the 'planning stage' the information isn't available at any time.
Number of hierarchical LUs that are contained in the outbound delivery. Depending on the 'planning stage' the information isn't available at any time.
Number of sub LUs that are contained in the outbound delivery. Depending on the 'planning stage' the information isn't available at any time.
Specifies the value (or amount) in weight unit which was entered by a user.
Uniquely identifies the weight unit.
Specifies the value (or amount) in volume unit which was entered by a user.
Uniquely identifies the volume unit.
Total dangerous goods points of all load loading units that are part of the outbound delivery.
Number of normalized floor space that is calculated for the outbound delivery contained loading units. Depending on the 'planning stage' the information isn't available at any time.
Defines the priority of this delivery.
The unique ID of this area within the WhLoc
The unique ID of the dock
Unique ID for the staging area.
The identifier of the storage location per warehouse location.
Defines whether splitting an OBO or OBD is allowed.
Is set to true if the outbound delivery has been canceled.
